oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The tip of the tongue of the Springbok is not eaten by children. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-25. 6025-6030). When the springbok's tongue-tip is eaten, the person stumbles over a stone and stubs his or her toe. 1) This story is found in Book V-25.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eating the springbok's tongue-tip
